articles.title: How can we get our shooters (Kennard and Rui) more shots?
articles.original_title: How can we get our shooters (Kennard and Rui) more shots?
articles.summary: Last night, Sam Hauser and Baylor Schierman both combined for TWELVE 3PAs! Twelve! Luke Kennard only attempted 1 three until the last 4 mins, and Rui only averages 4 attempts per game. You say they are defensive liabilities, but you look around the league and guys like Sam Merrill, Duncan Robinson, Landry Shamet, and Sam Hauser are all getting 5-7 attempts per game. These shooters are no better than what we have. They just have more opportunities to shoot the ball. Why aren't we getting our two

articles.title: WNBA, players union hold virtual CBA meeting with talks still far apart on key issues
articles.original_title: WNBA, players union hold virtual CBA meeting with talks still far apart on key issues
articles.summary: The WNBA and its players union held a virtual meeting Monday to try and further negotiations for a new collective bargaining agreement, a person familiar with the discussions told The Associated Press.  The person spoke to the AP on condition of anonymity because of the sensitive nature of the negotiations.  It was the first meeting between the two sides that involved players and the league since they met at the WNBA offices on Feb. 2.

articles.title: U.S. women's gold medal-winning team declines invitation from Trump to attend State of Union address
articles.original_title: U.S. women's gold medal-winning team declines invitation from Trump to attend State of Union address
articles.summary: The U.S. women's hockey gold medal-winning team has politely declined an invitation from President Donald Trump to attend his State of the Union address on Tuesday.  “We are sincerely grateful for the invitation extended to our gold medal–winning U.S. Women’s Hockey Team and deeply appreciate the recognition of their extraordinary achievement,” the U.S. women's team said in a statement released Monday.  Trump also invited the U.S. men's gold medal-winning team.

articles.title: Supersub strikes again as Sesko gives Man United win at Everton
articles.original_title: Supersub strikes again as Sesko gives Man United win at Everton
articles.summary: Manchester United supersub Benjamin Sesko scored 13 minutes after entering the field to give his side a 1-0 win over Everton in the Premier League on Monday.  It was the third time in four games that Sesko has scored after coming off the bench and secured points for United.  Bryan Mbeumo controlled Matheus Cunha’s superb long ball and played a perfectly weighted pass to the feet of Sesko, who steered the ball past Jordan Pickford with aplomb.
